title: Add X overlay on completed task icons, uncheck Follow Up by default, keep shaded completed cases, add Daily Summary task

requirements.text: Change the Follow Up task default state to unchecked in the checklist configuration so that new cases are created with Follow Up unselected by default.

quotes: Remove Follow up as a default checked task; default should be unchecked

acceptanceCriteria: When creating a new case, the Follow Up task checkbox is unchecked by default.
Existing cases are unaffected by this change.
The checklist.ts default selections no longer include Follow Up.

requirements.text: Completed cases must remain visible on the Dashboard (both in calendar view and list/grid view) but rendered with a visually shaded-out appearance (e.g., reduced opacity or muted background). They must not be removed or hidden.

quotes: When all tasks are completed, leave case on the Dashboard, just shaded out as noted in previous build

acceptanceCriteria: Cases where all tasks are completed remain visible on the Dashboard in both calendar and grid/list views.
Completed cases have a visually distinct shaded appearance (e.g., reduced opacity or muted background) compared to active cases.
Completed cases are never automatically removed or hidden from the Dashboard.

requirements.text: When a task is marked as completed, render an X overlay on top of the task's icon. The X should be visually overlaid on the icon itself (not on the text label). This applies to task icons in CaseCard, CalendarCaseCard, and ChecklistEditor components.

quotes: When a task is complete put a line through the icon
1. A line over the icon like an X

acceptanceCriteria: Completed task icons display an X overlaid on top of the icon graphic.
The X overlay is visible in both the Dashboard calendar view (CalendarCaseCard) and the Cases list view (CaseCard/ChecklistEditor).
Incomplete task icons display no X overlay.
The X is rendered as two crossing lines over the icon, not as a strikethrough on adjacent text.

requirements.text: Add a new 'Daily Summary' task to the checklist configuration used on both the Dashboard and Cases pages. The task defaults to unchecked. Its icon should depict a tear-off calendar page (a page with two digits/numbers on it, like a daily calendar sheet). The task must appear in CaseFormDialog, CaseEditDialog, ChecklistEditor, CaseCard, and CalendarCaseCard wherever other workflow tasks appear.

quotes: Add a task to both pages 'Daily Summary'; default unchecked; icon a piece of paper with two digits on it (like the page of a tear off calendar)

acceptanceCriteria: A 'Daily Summary' task option appears in the checklist on both Dashboard case cards and Cases page case cards.
Daily Summary is unchecked by default when creating a new case.
The Daily Summary task icon visually resembles a tear-off calendar page with two digits.
The Daily Summary task can be toggled as complete/incomplete like other tasks.
The X overlay (REQ-8) applies to the Daily Summary icon when it is marked complete.
Daily Summary appears in CaseFormDialog and CaseEditDialog task selection.
The backend Task type is updated to include 'dailySummary' as a valid task key.

constraints: Do not remove or hide completed cases from the Dashboard; they must remain visible but shaded.
The X overlay must be on the icon graphic itself, not on the text label.
immutablePaths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui) must not be modified.
nonGoals: Changing the visual style or layout of any other part of the Dashboard or Cases pages.
Adding any other new tasks beyond Daily Summary.
Modifying the weekly calendar navigation or column layout.
Removing completed cases from any view.
